Title.evidence: The randomized EORTC 10981-22023 AMAROS trial investigates whether breast cancer patients with a tumor-positive sentinel node biopsy (SNB) are best treated with an axillary lymph node dissection (ALND) or axillary radiotherapy (ART).

Trial_Design.evidence: The first 2,000 patients participating in the AMAROS trial were evaluated.

Intervention.evidence: The randomized EORTC 10981-22023 AMAROS trial investigates whether breast cancer patients with a tumor-positive sentinel node biopsy (SNB) are best treated with an axillary lymph node dissection (ALND) or axillary radiotherapy (ART).

Objective.evidence: The aim of the current substudy was to evaluate the identification rate and the nodal involvement.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The outcome of the SNB procedure and potential further nodal involvement was assessed.

Number_Randomised.evidence: The first 2,000 patients participating in the AMAROS trial were evaluated.

Number_Analysed.evidence: In 65 patients, the sentinel node could not be identified.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The SNB results of 65% of the patients ( n = 1,220) were negative and the patients underwent no further axillary treatment.
